title: Rockhopper Adventure Trail Run Returns to Kosrae Island in Micronesia in October
text:
Kosrae Visitors Bureau
TOFOL, KOSRAE, Federated States of Micronesia , Sept. 23, Scuba divers and adventure travelers who love to run are signing up for the third annual Rockhopper Adventure Trail Run set for Monday, October 12, 2015 on the Micronesian island of Kosrae . The 5.7-mile run will include on-road and off-road terrain that goes through inspiring scenery. Runners can enjoy some of the world's best scuba diving and eco-adventure trekking before and after the race as well as Kosrae's lush mangrove forests, ancient ruins and local culture. Kosrae is located halfway between Hawaii and Guam and is home to some of the world's most unspoiled coral reefs and blue-water dive sites .
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150922/269662
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150922/269663LOGO
To register for the race click here. The $40 race entry fee includes a commemorative race tee shirt and a prerace banquet; there is also a tee shirt-only $15 registration option. Runners and walkers of all ages are encouraged to participate.
The Rockhopper Trail Run starts and ends at the Pacific Treelodge Resort. The race start time is 7 AM .
Rockhopper Trail Run participants can take advantage of exclusive travel and lodging discounts. Kosrae Village Resort is offering a 20 percent discount off their normal room rates for all race participants and guests. Kosrae's Pacific Treelodge Resort will reimburse $15 'paid' entry fee plus provide free breakfast for each room night. Kosrae Nautilus Resort offers single rooms at $99 /night and double rooms at $114 / night and includes airport transfers. Email the hotels directly for the race discounts.
United Airlines is also offering a special race discount on air travel to Kosrae. Check the Kosrae Rockhopper Trail Run website for discount codes.
Kosrae's scuba diving, tropical beauty and relaxing vibe are plenty enough reason to visit the island. Kosrae also hosts cultural and commemorative events year round. Visiting during these times is a great way to see Kosrae at its most festive.
ABOUT KOSRAE
Kosrae is an eco-travel destination and an internationally acclaimed scuba dive destination. A 42-square-mile island, it is one of the four states of the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM). Kosrae's reefs are considered to be among the most pristine remaining in the world. Learn more on the Kosrae Island Facebook page.
